item.title: Dune: Awakening And Rematch Mark Strong Launches As Both Enter June 2025’s Top 10 Games By Revenue Per Global Firm Newzoo
item.content:encoded:
Global data firm Newzoo has released its latest report on the top 10 games for June 2025 by both monthly active users (MAU) and revenue. In its report for May 2025, Elden Ring Nightreign was the top story, but this time around, it's Dune all June, as Dune: Awakening breaks into the top-5 games by revenue, and Sloclap's arcade football game Rematch is able to eek into the top-10.

Nightreign hasn't entirely fallen off the map, to be fair, it's just a few places behind where it sat in May, as Dune: Awakening took Nightreign's place as the number five game in the list of top 10 games by revenue. Rematch, for its part, made it to number nine, while everything else in the top 10 rankings mostly stayed the same, save for Valorant jumping up six places to make it into the top 10 at number seven.

Zooming out a bit more into the top-20, other notable entries are Toby Fox's Deltarune, which snuck in at number 20, and the highly anticipated release of Death Stranding 2: On the Beach, which arrived at the tail-end of June and made it into the top-20 games by revenue in 15th place.

Dead By Daylight was another notable entry in the top-20 games by revenue, in part because it was one of the few games to hold a top-20 spot in both revenue and MAUs for June 2025. It jumped 17 places from May to make it into the top-20 games by revenue for June, and 13 places to do the same in MAUs, both driven by a new collaboration with Five Nights at Freddy's.

The MAU list for June 2025 was less malleable than the revenue list, as very little changed regarding the top 10. Elden Ring Nightreign, Rematch, and Splitgate 2 were the only games not in the top-20 for MAUs in May 2025 that were able to jump into the top-20 for June.

Here's Newzoo's full report and overview for June 2025 for the top games on PC and consoles:

Engagement Highlights

  • Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Siege X (#7, +3) ushered in a new chapter with the launch of Siege X. The update introduced a fresh game mode, revamped maps and movement mechanics, and compelling incentives for returning players, introducing rewards based on years of service.  
  • NBA 2K25 (#9, +2) rolled out Season 8, coinciding with a major cross-platform sale that boosted player engagement.  
  • Star Wars Battlefront II (2017) (#12, +3) continues to benefit from a community-driven resurgence that began in May. EA capitalized on this momentum by offering steep discounts during the Steam Summer Sale, resulting in a 27% month-over-month increase in monthly active users across all platforms.  
  • ELDEN RING NIGHTREIGN (#13, +20) launched May 29. Thus, the July steep increase in engagement is in line with expectations. Ongoing updates and bug fixes have steadily improved its reception, with Steam reviews climbing to 82% lifetime and 87% recent.  
  • Dead by Daylight (#15, +13) saw its highest engagement in over four years following the release of its Five Nights at Freddy’s crossover DLC on June 17.  
  • REMATCH (2025) (#16, +45) officially launched on June 19, nearly doubling its engagement compared to the final May playtest - marking a strong debut.  
  • Splitgate 2 (#17, +43) officially launched on June 7, introducing the Battle Royale mode for the first time - an addition not available during earlier play tests.

Revenue Movers and Breakthroughs

  • Dune: Awakening (#5, new) launched on June 10 and attracted 1.3 million players within its first 20 days, underscoring the enduring appeal and strength of the Dune IP.  
  • Valorant (#7, +6) celebrated its fifth anniversary on June 2 with a major update that introduced a new season and new map. The game also saw a significant engagement boost, fueled by a major international tournament  
  • REMATCH (2025) (#9, new) broke into the top 10 highest-grossing games of June following its release. The surge in players on its paid ($29.99) release compared to its free play tests highlights both the game’s quality and the demand for fresh, competitive experiences.  
  • League of Legends (#12, +7) honored Jian "Uzi" Zihao as the second inductee into its Hall of Legends. Commemorative cosmetics celebrating the player were released as part of the tribute.  
  • Death Stranding 2: On The Beach (#15, new) debuted on June 26 as a PlayStation exclusive, selling over 400,000 copies in just the final five days of the month.  
  • Dead by Daylight (#16, +17) partnered with Five Nights at Freddy’s for its latest DLC, released on June 17. This collaboration drove the game’s highest monthly revenue since Newzoo began tracking in April 2020.  
  • DELTARUNE (#20, new) the latest release from the creators of UNDERTALE, launched on June 4 and has already drawn in over one million players, building on the success of its predecessor.
